verses.plain: My soul is weary of my life; I will leave my complaint upon myself; I will speak in the bitterness of my soul.

tokens.t: My soul is weary of my life; I will leave my complaint upon myself; I will speak in the bitterness of my soul.

verses.plain: I will say unto God, Do not condemn me; shew me wherefore thou contendest with me.

tokens.t: I will say unto God, Do not condemn me; shew me wherefore thou contendest with me.

verses.plain: Is it good unto thee that thou shouldest oppress, that thou shouldest despise the work of thine hands, and shine upon the counsel of the wicked?

tokens.t: good unto thee that thou shouldest oppress, that thou shouldest despise the work of thine hands, and shine upon the counsel of the wicked?

verses.plain: Hast thou eyes of flesh? or seest thou as man seeth?

tokens.t: Hast thou eyes of flesh? or seest thou as man seeth?

verses.plain: Are thy days as the days of man? are thy years as man’s days,

tokens.t: thy days as the days of man?
thy years as man’s days,

verses.plain: That thou enquirest after mine iniquity, and searchest after my sin?

tokens.t: That thou enquirest after mine iniquity, and searchest after my sin?

verses.plain: Thou knowest that I am not wicked; and there is none that can deliver out of thine hand.

tokens.t: Thou knowest that I am not wicked; and
none that can deliver out of thine hand.

verses.plain: Thine hands have made me and fashioned me together round about; yet thou dost destroy me.

tokens.t: Thine hands have made me and fashioned me together round about; yet thou dost destroy me.

verses.plain: Remember, I beseech thee, that thou hast made me as the clay; and wilt thou bring me into dust again?

tokens.t: Remember, I beseech thee, that thou hast made me as the clay; and wilt thou bring me into dust again?

verses.plain: Hast thou not poured me out as milk, and curdled me like cheese?

tokens.t: Hast thou not poured me out as milk, and curdled me like cheese?

verses.plain: Thou hast clothed me with skin and flesh, and hast fenced me with bones and sinews.

tokens.t: Thou hast clothed me with skin and flesh, and hast fenced me with bones and sinews.

verses.plain: Thou hast granted me life and favour, and thy visitation hath preserved my spirit.

tokens.t: Thou hast granted me life and favour, and thy visitation hath preserved my spirit.

verses.plain: And these things hast thou hid in thine heart: I know that this is with thee.

tokens.t: And these
hast thou hid in thine heart: I know that this
with thee.

verses.plain: If I sin, then thou markest me, and thou wilt not acquit me from mine iniquity.

tokens.t: If I sin, then thou markest me, and thou wilt not acquit me from mine iniquity.

verses.plain: If I be wicked, woe unto me; and if I be righteous, yet will I not lift up my head. I am full of confusion; therefore see thou mine affliction;

tokens.t: If I be wicked, woe unto me; and
I be righteous,
will I not lift up my head.
full of confusion; therefore see thou mine affliction;

verses.plain: For it increaseth. Thou huntest me as a fierce lion: and again thou shewest thyself marvellous upon me.

tokens.t: For it increaseth. Thou huntest me as a fierce lion: and again thou shewest thyself marvellous upon me.

verses.plain: Thou renewest thy witnesses against me, and increasest thine indignation upon me; changes and war are against me.

tokens.t: Thou renewest thy witnesses against me, and increasest thine indignation upon me; changes and war
against me.

verses.plain: Wherefore then hast thou brought me forth out of the womb? Oh that I had given up the ghost, and no eye had seen me!

tokens.t: Wherefore then hast thou brought me forth out of the womb? Oh that I had given up the ghost, and no eye had seen me!

verses.plain: I should have been as though I had not been; I should have been carried from the womb to the grave.

tokens.t: I should have been as though I had not been; I should have been carried from the womb to the grave.

verses.plain: Are not my days few? cease then, and let me alone, that I may take comfort a little,

tokens.t: not my days few? cease
let me alone, that I may take comfort a little,

verses.plain: Before I go whence I shall not return, even to the land of darkness and the shadow of death;

tokens.t: Before I go
I shall not return,
to the land of darkness and the shadow of death;

verses.plain: A land of darkness, as darkness itself; and of the shadow of death, without any order, and where the light is as darkness.

tokens.t: A land of darkness, as darkness
of the shadow of death, without any order, and
the light
as darkness.

footnotes.text: weary…: or, cut off while I live
Thou…: Heb. It is upon thy knowledge
have…: Heb. took pains about me
